page.title: 04Train Tragedy in 1940
page.content: On the night of 4th Nov.1940, the 9.30 p.m. Express from Paddington was late arriving at Taunton and the signalman gave priority to a newspaper train coming through on time. The Express was put on the relief line which merged with the main line just before Norton Fitzwarren station. Unfortunately the driver of the Express did not realize he had been diverted and watched the signals set for the train on the main line. He realized too late to prevent his King George IV engine being derailed where the quadrupled track ends. Six coaches were strewn across all four tracks, killing 27 of the 900 passengers. The newspaper train escaped without damage, although it stopped briefly at the Victory crossing to investigate the light blow it had received at the rear.
